remarks.para: One symmetrical pair may be inoperative in down position provided:

numlitem.para: All flight spoilers are verified to be operative once each flight day,
Anti-skid system is operative,
Flaps 1 takeoff operation is prohibited, and
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied.
Observe LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

note.para: SPOILER amber light on the overhead panel will be illuminated and the SPOILER message on EICAS will be displayed.

numlitem.para: Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 1.
Takeoff Weight Reduction - 3,200 lbs. to Runway Limit Weight.
Landing Weight Reduction - see the destination airport analysis for Max Landing Weight with Manual Spoilers.
Minimum field length is 6,000 ft.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.
Anti-skid system must be operative.
Flap 1 operations for takeoff not authorized.

placard.para: Placard near EICAS "SPOILERS NO’s X and Y INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: Spoiler Systems

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: This relief does not apply if spoiler panel is detached from the actuator and could float up or is not in the retracted position.

warning.para: TO PREVENT INJURY OR DAMAGE, CLEAR PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT FROM CONTROL SURFACES BEFORE PROVIDING HYDRAULIC POWER. KEEP AREA CLEAR WHEN OPERATING CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Ensure that all operative spoilers operate correctly (no more than one spoiler pair inoperative) once each flight day:
Turn the control wheel full counterclockwise (left). Observe that operative left wing spoilers extend.

note.para: Spoilers 1, 2, 3 and 5 will extend approximately 45 degrees. Spoiler 6 will extend approximately 30 degrees (panel 4 will not extend).

numlitem.para: Turn the control wheel full clockwise (right). Observe that operative right wing spoilers extend.

note.para: Spoilers 8, 10, 11 and 12 will extend approximately 45 degrees. Spoiler 7 will extend approximately 30 degrees (panel 9 will not extend).

numlitem.para: Place speed brake lever in the UP position. Ensure that all operative spoilers are operative (panels 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 10, 11, and 12 will extend approximately 45 degrees; panels 6 and 7 will extend approximately 30 degrees; panels 4 and 9 will extend approximately 55 degrees).
Ensure that the inoperative spoiler pair remain down. If the inoperative spoiler pair rise, perform step 2 to deactivate the inoperative pair.
To disable a spoiler pair and secure it in the retracted position, do the procedure that follows:

warning.para: ACCIDENTAL SPOILER MOVEMENT CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT.

numlitem.para: Fully extend trailing edge flaps.
Remove power from the left, right and center hydraulic systems (Ref. MM 29-11-00/201).

warning.para: ENSURE THAT HYDRAULIC POWER WILL NOT BE SUPPLIED TO THE PCA DURING MAINTENANCE. THE SPOILER PANEL WILL RETRACT IMMEDIATELY AND CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT.

numlitem.para: With a 5/32 inch Allen wrench, operate the manual release cam on the bottom of the PCA pairs to be disabled and manually move the spoiler panels to the up position. Return manual release cam to normal position.
Disconnect the electrical connector from the PCA, cap and stow the connectors for flight.
Manually move the spoiler panel to a position slightly above the neutral position.

warning.para: MAKE SURE THAT ALL PERSONS AND EQUIPMENT ARE AWAY FROM THE CONTROL SURFACES BEFORE HYDRAULIC POWER IS SUPPLIED. STAY AWAY FROM THE AREA DURING THEIR OPERATION.

numlitem.para: Pressurize the left, center and right hydraulic systems (Ref. MM 29-11-00/201).
Make sure that the deactivated spoiler panels return to their neutral positions and are held in this position by their PCA's.
Turn the control wheel full counterclockwise (left). Ensure that the operative left wing spoilers extend.

note.para: Spoilers 1, 2, 3, and 5 will extend approximately 45 degrees. Spoiler number 6 will extend approximately 30 degrees (panel 4 will not extend).

numlitem.para: Turn the control wheel full clockwise (right). Ensure that the operative right wing spoilers extend.

note.para: Spoilers 8, 10, 11, and 12 will extend approximately 45 degrees. Spoiler number 7 will extend approximately 30 degrees (panel 9 will not extend).

numlitem.para: Place speed brake lever in the UP position. Ensure that all operative spoilers are operative (panels 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 10, 11, and 12 will extend approximately 45 degrees; panels 6 and 7 will extend approximately 30 degrees; panels 4 and 9 will extend approximately 55 degrees.
Ensure that the inoperative spoiler pair remain down and do not move. If the inoperative panel pair is not secured in the down position, dispatch is not allowed.
Return flaps to normal.
